Description: Tapestry medallion applied and sewn onto an undyed, plain weave linen textile; the centre of the medallion is decorated with a Greek vase with leaves and flowers springing from the vase, inbetween the vegetal motifs are four birds depicted; all motifs are in yellow on a red background; the central medallion is surrounded by a freize of yellow and green interlacing with dark blue and red heart-shaped leaves on each side, on a beige background; the freize is bordered each side by multi-coloured geometric motifs; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/15), weft-undyed linen (S/11); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/10), weft-bleached linen (S), yellow, red, green, dark blue wool (S/yellow is 64); oversewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply); all edges are cut or ragged
Curator's comments: textile sewn to modern beige textile
Bibliographic references: Budge 1922 / British Museum. Guide to the fourth, fifth and sixth Egyptian rooms, and the Coptic room (p.228) (Table case H, no. 17)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
